intro: Cheilanthes sparsisora, commonly known as the sparse-stemmed rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and is typically found growing on rocky outcrops or in crevices. The plant has lanceolate, leathery leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in conditions with limited moisture. Cheilanthes sparsisora is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in rocky habitats.
